references.paper_title: WebShop: Towards scalable real-world web interaction with grounded language agents
references.reason: This paper introduces WebShop, a benchmark environment used extensively in the current paper for evaluating the performance of language agents, making it a crucial reference for understanding the context and experimental setup.

references.paper_title: ALFWWorld: Aligning text and embodied environments for interactive learning
references.reason: Similar to WebShop, ALFWorld is another key environment used for experimental evaluation in the paper; its inclusion as a reference is critical for understanding the evaluation methodology and results.

references.paper_title: ScienceWorld: Is your agent smarter than a 5th grader?
references.reason: ScienceWorld, yet another important benchmark dataset used in this work, is introduced in this reference; understanding this environment is essential for interpreting the results.
This seminal paper introduces Q-learning, the core reinforcement learning algorithm upon which the proposed QLASS method builds, making it a fundamental theoretical reference for the current work.
This book provides the foundational mathematical framework for dynamic programming, which is crucial for understanding the Q-value estimation and Bellman equation used in QLASS.
